alert.note: Alert for Christian; Stone (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 25 at 5:35AM CDT until March 26 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... James River NEAR Boaz affecting Stone and Christian Counties. .Heavy rainfall that occurred Thursday evening and early Friday has led to the river rising several feet above flood stage. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...James River near Boaz. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Approximate level when Hootentown Access and Campground downstream of the gage floods. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 AM CDT Saturday the stage was 14.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 AM CDT Saturday was 18.6 feet. - Forecast...The river has crested and is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 4.6 feet early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
